text: Today we celebrate the 231st anniversary of the signing of the Constitution of the United States of America. We honor the men and women who helped create this amazing document. https://t.co/lIbsjvU3ra

There are over 1,000 firefighters battling the #PoleCreekFire and #BaldMountainFire, and more on the way. Still no structures lost, and only minimal injuries. There are concerns that these fires will continue to move north. This is a marathon, not a sprint. https://t.co/nE3LN6IjzK

The number one priority in these fires is protecting life and property. So grateful for all our community partners helping us with constant collaboration and good counsel. #PoleCreekfire #BaldMountainFire https://t.co/utnUoQ0JNH

Was very impressed by the coordination and hard work on the #PoleCreek and #BaldMountain fires today. We have an amazing team of firefighters, and astoundingly well-prepared communities. It will be a long haul, but I trust our teams. https://t.co/mbGK1tmkaO
So good to see a slight change in the weather today. Better wind conditions enabled fire teams to make more direct aerial attacks on the fires. https://t.co/QoflvpNv6t

While containment levels for the #BaldMointainFire and #PoleCreekFire are low, strong control measures are in place. We’re hoping to see some more good news in the next 24 hours. https://t.co/XXciHqGVE5
. @UtahDEQ is providing helpful information on how to minimize the impact wildfire smoke can have on your health. Those concerned can learn more on their page. https://t.co/mvl26D99Si

Exciting to see @JonSPierpont of @JobsUT selected to serve as president of the National Association of State Workforce Agencies' board of directors. I look forward to seeing his good work continue on a national stage.
Today is POW/MIA Day in Utah. We honor all Americans still missing and unaccounted-for. https://t.co/vzm0fEhyjg

Utah's economy continues to succeed. Last month we had the best job growth in the country. 
https://t.co/xhT9f1bbJl
I am so grateful for the firefighters working to protect our communities. Thank you for all you do, and stay safe! #PoleCreekFire #BaldMountainFire https://t.co/1Ns9OopjaM
Congrats to President Ruth Watkins, a seasoned leader destined to achieve even greater excellence at the U. https://t.co/MxWIIhx2vj
Utah's giving spirit is one of my favorite things about our state. https://t.co/5eviLKxiXQ
In Elk Ridge working with community leaders on a firm plan to protect neighborhoods near recent wildfires and burn scars from flooding as Tropical Storm Rosa heads our way. https://t.co/TCPZsWlSDw

To better understand the future of our state, I invited high school students to share their thoughts with me. I’m grateful they took the time to help me understand their unique challenges and beliefs. https://t.co/AQlx237SDp

I activated the @UTNationalGuard today to get protections in place for communities in southern Utah County. These communities have been recently impacted by the #PoleCreekFire and #BaldMountainFire and are at a risk for flash flooding as heavy rains are headed toward our state. https://t.co/ukfzyLLuem
Read this thread if you need information on what the state is doing to prevent flood damage: https://t.co/YAbkARAUcm
It’s beautiful outside now, but we’re expecting heavy rains that could cause real damage in communities near burn scars (like Woodland Hills, Elk Ridge and Covered Bridge).

I have declared a state of emergency due to potential flooding. The @NWS has issued a flash flood watch for much for Utah. Communities near burn scars created by recent wildfires are at increased risk. Heed all warnings and orders from local public safety officials. https://t.co/w6li5MDlVC
Grateful to have US Attorney Jeff Sessions here in Utah to recognize the good work of our police officers. @TheJusticeDept @DUTnews https://t.co/UXk5832CBS
Grateful to the @UTNationalGuard for all their work in our communities this week. https://t.co/urKEtKPjqZ

Thank you @GHughes51, @WayneNieder, @LibertasUtah, Utah Medical Association, @UtahPatients, and @LDSChurch and so many others for coming together on a compromise that will bring solid and lasting medical marijuana policy to Utah.

Jeanette and I send our deepest condolences to President M. Russell Ballard and his family at the loss of his dear wife, Sister Barbara Bowen Ballard. She valued the things that matter most – family and faith – and she dedicated her life to nurture both.

Earlier today, I addressed those attending the 25K Rural Economic Development Retreat @SnowCollege We are ahead of the pace required to reach our goal, but we must continue to work together for our rural communities. https://t.co/LolJt6VXww

I had the privilege of meeting with the honorable Valeriy Chaly, Ambassador of Ukraine to the United States. There is much we can share with, and learn from, this great nation. https://t.co/0SaYb6tbmE
Congratulations Dr. Dobkin on being named the 19th President of @WestminsterSLC https://t.co/Q2kPPrLBxu
Thank you @arthurbrooks for graciously presenting to my cabinet. Your words and ideas inspire us. I wish you the same success you found at @AEI in your new role at @Harvard https://t.co/32sbHnFrJG
This afternoon I appointed Casey Snider to the @UtahReps. He will fill the vacancy left by Rep. Curt Webb in the fifth district. Welcome to the Utah Legislature, Rep. Snider. https://t.co/Wp5Wgaz7C1
Wonderful to join @uvu_president at Grand County High School today to speak with students. Dream big. If you believe it - and work hard - you can achieve it. https://t.co/4pACfodfvG

Appreciated reading @RobertGehrke's perspective on why voting yes on Question 1 is so important for the future of education (and righting our tax system) here in Utah. #utpol @sltrib https://t.co/Eyflm09cOu
My heart goes out to all who have been dealing with the tragic #UofUShooting tonight. Stay safe, and please follow the instructions that come thru https://t.co/QzpotFl9kq

If anyone has information about the suspect identified by the U of U police in tonight’s shooting, please contact police immediately: Melvin Rowland, 37 yrs, 6’3”, 250 lbs, last seen with gray beanie, white hoodie, black pants, white shoes. https://t.co/TRfLYZq0T3
Toured the new @slcairport construction site today. The project is on time and on budget, and I look forward to seeing its completion in 2020. https://t.co/T33ra53XIf

The mood is somber here on the University of Utah Campus as we mourn the tragic loss of Lauren McCluskey. We mourn with her family, her friends, her teammates and the entire University of Utah community.

I have called on our congressional delegation to lead on this, but until this is addressed at the federal level we must commit ourselves as a state to creating a medical cannabis solution that works for Utah. I believe in the compromise. https://t.co/mDxGEaYPFu
Completely horrified and deeply saddened to hear of the shooting at the Tree of Life synagogue in Pittsburgh today.
Flags will fly half-staff through Wed., Oct. 31 in memory of the victims of the shooting at the Tree of Life Synagogue in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. https://t.co/lOtIFejk16
Happy birthday to the oldest man in Utah! 105 years old and still going strong. Wishing you many more to come, Don Kirk!
Grateful to join with members of our Jewish community this evening in prayer. Light is more powerful than darkness. https://t.co/SZk5QcL9Sc
Enjoyed answering the thoughtful questions posed by @Deltarabbits students alongside @andersonljess of @UtahDPS the future of Utah is bright. https://t.co/ufzLIaPLw3

Sorry to hear about the health challenges of my good friend, @JonHuntsman, who has taught and continues to teach me so much about honorable public service.
https://t.co/ePLY68dYE2
We will miss you, Dan. https://t.co/jLgcPdRT57
Heartbroken that we lost one of our own today. @UTNationalGuard https://t.co/SHFf5qmACU

I am heartbroken at the loss of Major Brent Taylor. Our deepest condolences and constant prayers are with his wife Jennie, his children and the entire Taylor family. All of Utah mourns with you. https://t.co/Ib9oysyDCN
I'll be talking to @BoydMatheson about Question 1 on @kslnewsradio in just a few minutes. Tune in to learn more.

Having worked with @RepPatriceArent over the years, I can say that while we don’t agree on every topic, I have always appreciated her dedication to preserving freedom of religion and conscience. She is a wonderful person who respects others’ points of view. https://t.co/7ZIaDtRLu4
We are happy to celebrate Native American Heritage Month with our Utah residents. https://t.co/09gf7V56rQ
The Middle Class is alive and well in the State of Utah! Pleased to see that our healthy economy continues to receive recognition. https://t.co/8DGwq5FfHh

Jennie Taylor gave a powerful statement last night. God bless this family, and God bless America. 
https://t.co/jPU9Q0TMCq
Congratulations to my good friend, and our new senator, @MittRomney. You will make Utah proud! #utpol https://t.co/Reu9vkcj7t
Congratulations, Rep. Curtis! I look forward to seeing more of your good work in Washington. #utpol https://t.co/EOBvD3Z8R4
Congratulations to @VPNez, the new president of the Navajo Nation. I look forward to working with you. https://t.co/P77joDqiIY

It was a privilege and honor to meet with some of the brave men and women who serve our state as Military Base Commanders. I am grateful for their hard work and dedication to keeping us safe. https://t.co/UBfR5O1xul
Flags have been lowered out of respect for the victims of the Thousand Oaks shooting. We mourn with our California neighbors. #utpol https://t.co/xErwj318em

Congratulations to our newly elected legislative leadership. I am excited about the future and working collaboratively with these new leaders to ensure Utah remains the best place to live, work, and raise a family. #utpol https://t.co/SeuXCY807Y

Reminder: community organizations hoping to receive a Suicide Prevention and Crisis Response Grant from the Governor’s Suicide Prevention Fund need to submit their proposals to @UTHumanServices DSAMH by December 15th.
The poppy is a symbol of remembrance. On this historic day, the 100th anniversary of the end of WWI, we remember those who have served our country, living and dead. https://t.co/ecjBns34lZ

This week I had the chance to visit the Vietnam Wall Replica. I encourage everyone to go visit this magnificent structure commemorating the veterans who served during that war. https://t.co/jgp3kRl9Wd

Grateful to the many faith leaders who joined in this year's faith leaders luncheon. I hope we will continue to lift one another up and that Utah will always be a place of faith for all of us. https://t.co/iavrbjnrqR
We will miss Stan Lee. He was a remarkable talent. He leaves a legacy of super heroes and super entertainment. https://t.co/ffp7oJLDtd
I’m at the @KemGardnerInst this morning talking about how tax reform can help our economy to succeed. #utpol https://t.co/ttRFi3DKI6
Jim Hansen will be greatly missed. We need more public servants like him. #utpol https://t.co/F8XUdbijYb
We will not forget you, Major Taylor. https://t.co/CP2ULTcNz3
Tonight we were honored to host esteemed guests of varying faiths in celebration of Diwali, the festival of lights. We wish a happy #Diwali to all in Utah. https://t.co/rUoCRDlwgs
Good morning! Join me and @KUED for our monthly news conference beginning shortly. #utpol

We have lost three iconic figures in our community: former Congressman Jim Hansen, a good man and politician; Dan Jones, an icon in polling and politics and a personal friend of mine, and Maj. Brent Taylor, the personification of citizen and soldier.
Reporting from the Gold Room. Tune in with me at 12-1pm on "Let Me Speak With the Governor" on KSL. Looking forward to speaking with you and answering your questions. https://t.co/TEPgy8FBjU
Flags will be lowered to half-staff this Saturday in honor of Major Brent Taylor. https://t.co/0K9vBmURvB
Glad to join my fellow western governors in welcoming new governors-elect to the @NatlGovsAssoc in Colorado today. #utpol @westgov https://t.co/l33Rdw1ixR
Mourning with Major Taylor’s family. Seeking healing for them. And praying they will find joy in a life well lived and in the promised blessings of eternal life. https://t.co/yjlrvhDuWw
